title: How to run geth on raspberry 3B (I have already built a private chain but I can't run miner.start)
body:
#### System information
This is my geth version:
```
ubuntu@ubuntu:~$ geth version
Geth
Version: 1.8.3-stable
Architecture: arm
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.9.2
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=/home/bin/go
GOROOT=/home/ubuntu/go
```

#### Expected behaviour
I want to run geth on raspberry and miner on it 

#### Actual behaviour
The question is just as I said in title, I have already built a private chain on raspberry 3B, but I can't run miner.start(),because when i run it, it tell me an error.

I'm not sure whether it's a 32 bit limitation or you are really running out of memory. Why do you want to run a mining node on an RPI? If you want to run a private network, it might make more sense to run a `Clique` PoA network where there is no heavy PoW mining.
Closing as a limitation of the 32bit arm platform. Please open a new issue if you think this should work and it still happens on latest master.
